issues.description: The template's Main.java (commented example usage) calls farm.feed(); but the problem statement and solution use/require feedAllAnimals(). This inconsistency in the method name/signature in the template's example can confuse students about which method to implement/use and may lead them to try to call a non-existing method when testing (especially if they uncomment the example).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template example consistent with the specification and solution. Replace the call to farm.feed(); in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java with farm.feedAllAnimals(); (or update the problem statement and solution to use feed() if that name was intended). Keeping the same method name everywhere (feedAllAnimals) will avoid confusion.

issues.description: The template's example usage in Main.java calls farm.feed(), while the problem statement and the solution expect a method named feedAllAnimals(). This inconsistent method name for the same conceptual operation (feeding all animals on the farm) can confuse students: they may attempt to implement or call feed() based on the template example or expect feedAllAnimals() based on the assignment description and tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the naming consistent: update the template example in src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java to call farm.feedAllAnimals() instead of farm.feed(), so it matches the problem statement and the solution. Alternatively, if feed() is preferred, rename the method in the problem statement and solution to feed()—but ensure all three artifacts use the same identifier.
